intro: Trichosalpinx tenuiflora, commonly known as the slender-flowered trichosalpinx, is a member of the Malvaceae family. It is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant typically grows as an erect herb with hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are small, tubular, and often pink or purple in color, arranged in clusters. It is characterized by its unique floral structure and is adapted to thrive in dry, open habitats.
